sidebar.para: Due to the high economic and entertainment specialties of &nation_name;, it draws craftsman and tourists from all over the world. Unless described otherwise, you can assume that almost any race can be represented as either a craftsman or a tourist.

Futhermore, the nation of &cliffs_nation; has no discrimination against any race so long as they can carry their weight in war. &cliffs_nation_person; bodyguards, hunters, policemen, and members of any other profession that involves martial prowess can easily find employment in &nation_name; regardless of their racial background.

section.para: Humans are the dominant race in the central cities and in the nation at large, despite the generally high levels of diversity in the country. Humans native to &nation_name; are represented in all professions, and tend to hold the majority of influential positions both in the economic and political spheres. They can be found in every major city and in the outlying areas of the country.

Humans hailing from other parts of the continent tend to come to &nation_name; for more specialized reasons. Farmers, clerics on pilgrimage, and visiting aristocrats from &meadows_nation; are all common sights. The goat-riding &mountainmen; from the peaks of &mountains_nation; are more rare, but sometimes come down to the valley for supplies or when they are seeking lesser or perhaps even greater solitude than they found among their people in the mountains. The exotic &firepeople; from neighboring &desert_kingdom; are often employed as guides and laborers, although some have left their homes to make a living as performers in &arts_city;. Humans from &forest_nation; are significantly more rare, but occasionally a prodigy from the mage's academy or a wayward druid will make an appearance.

Because of the rich underground resources in the country, dwarves are frequently drawn here. Most dwarves hail from the mountains in &mountains_nation; to live with their bretheren in the large network of dwarven homes that have been built under the earth. Although most dwarves will be living in the outlying areas of the nation, many certainly do find their way to the central cities.

Most dwarves will find &market_city; to their liking, as the ever-open markets and vendors offer a great opportunity to sell their wares and find rare materials. Some dwarves with an eye for government or leadership settle in &law_city; and take a post in a guild or legal office. Dwarves in the legal realm tend to put their strong racial loyalties to use defending the interests of other dwarves, and as such many find their way into positions as District Representatives. Dwarves rarely tend to have the patience for as wild a city as &arts_city;.

Elves do come to the central cities in some numbers, but are rarely found elsewhere the nation. Drawn by the wealth of craftsmanship and artistic talent, elves come to display their own prowess and compare their works to other master artisans'. Because of this, most elves make their home in a de-facto elven district in &market_city;, where they can live in a manner closer to home while still reaping the advantages of the city. Elves almost never bother with the political and mercantile business that takes place in &law_city;, but sometimes are drawn to the lively music and performances in &arts_city;.

Most of the elves living in &nation_name; hail from from &forest_nation;, and those that are not craftsmen are most often artists or performers, members of the mage's academy, druids, rangers, or clerics of Shelyn.

The constant festivites and general excitement of &arts_city; are perfectly suited to the typical gnome's demeanor. There they delight in taking part in or simply watching performances. While some rise to great heights in official groups, most gnomes find great pleasure in being street performers or vendors. Gnomes with an eye for business or a craving for the excitement of mercantile enterprises will sometimes venture into &market_city; to try their luck there. &law_city; is far too boring and rigid for the majority of Gnomes, and they are rarely seen there.

Halflings dovetail with ease into the hubbub and excitement of the central cities, and they can be found in great numbers all over the country. Artisans, shopkeepers, performers, and even occasionally politicians, a &nation_person; halfling's upbeat and amiable attitude is a formidable asset.

Half-elves face no discrimination for their mixed origin in any of the central cities, where diversity is welcome and omnipresent. Because of this welcoming environment, half-elves have flourished in the region and many travel from distant lands to come here. They are the second most populous race in &nation_name;. Here, their mixed origin plays to their advantage, and they are well suited to any role. However, many heed the call of their elven side and find themselves as either artisans in &market_city; or performers in &arts_city;.

Although diversity is welcomed in the central cities, brutishness and crassness are not. Although not hated or feared by any means, most half-orcs simply do not fit into the lifestyle of these cities, and so choose instead to live in the outlying towns and villages of the nation. Those who do choose to live the cities tend to make their living as bodyguards for wealthy politicians or merchants, or as a part of the police force.
